function_call.name: eval_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":["Increase in t cell apoptosis in covid-19 patients","Creation of pathogenic strains through synthetic biology","Mutations leading to increased infectivity and immune evasion","Contaminated water or environment as a source of infection","Lack of understanding of vectors and their behavior leading to ineffective control measures","Lack of cross-border collaboration leading to uncoordinated efforts in disease control","Limited vector control methods leading to ineffective disease control","Reliance on single vector control tools leading to unsustainable disease control measures","Lack of funding and weak programmatic capacity","Environmental change, insecticide resistance, and population growth","Inadequate vector control measures leading to the maintenance of robust disease transmission","Lack of collaboration with non-health sectors in vector control","Inadequate development and testing of novel vector control tools","Emergence of insecticide resistance in anopheles and aedes vectors","Reduction in the number of entomologists working at who's headquarters in geneva","Shift in vector control approaches to uniform insecticide-based commodities","Underfunding of vector control r&d and programmes","Global financing shortfalls for malaria control and elimination","Lack of effective vaccines for vector-borne diseases","Complacency and lack of investment in vector control","Lack of political will and central coordination","Inadequate housing and lack of basic services, including water and waste management, create ideal habitats for expanding ae. aegypti populations","Geographic expansion of vectors and viruses through globalization and urbanization","Lack of investment in aedes vector control leading to ineffective prevention of aedes-borne epidemics","Lack of effective control methods for tsetse flies","Relaxation of disease control programs in non-endemic regions","Neglect of surveillance activities leading to increase in hat cases","Scaling down of tsetse control campaigns leading to increase in hat cases","Delay in eliminating transmission of hat by 2030","Chagas disease and leishmaniasis transmission","Ineffective vector control methods","Impact of vector behavior on disease control","Insecticide and drug resistance","Rebound of malaria transmission after intervention cessation","Aerial spraying resulting in concerns about the environmental impact of ddt and dieldrin","Use of ddt and dieldrin in control programs","Weak vector control and surveillance","Inadequate political support for eradication campaigns","Cross-border invasion of ae. aegypti","Abandonment of environmental management practices like drainage of marshes and housing improvements","Parasite resistance to drugs and mosquito resistance to insecticides","Reduced funding and lack of community participation","Increased reliance on insecticide-based control","Indiscriminate use of ddt for malaria control","Exclusion of sub-saharan africa from global malaria eradication programme","Use of residual insecticides","Anopheles gambiae eradication","High population densities of ae. aegypti in rio de janeiro","Colonial expansion in ssa and massive outbreaks of hat","Risk of mosquito-borne diseases like malaria and yellow fever due to standing water and unsanitary living conditions","High human toxicity and ecological concerns from the use of paris green for larviciding","Outbreaks of yellow fever and malaria taking the lives of us soldiers in cuba","Reliance on labor-intensive environmental control measures for vbd control","Lack of housing improvements for vbd prevention","Inadequate understanding of vector ecology and behavior","Inadequate understanding of disease transmission routes","Ineffective vector control methods"]}
